snippet: James B. Comey, the bureau director, said that Tashfeen Malik and Syed Rizwan Farook used private online messages to communicate their commitment to Islamic extremists, not social media.
abstract: FBI director James B Comey reveals online accounts of couple behind shooting in San Bernadino, Calif, Tashfeen Malik and Syed Rizwan Farook, show they were not involved with larger cell or terrorists overseas but instead shared private messages where they conveyed their support for ideals by Islamic extremists.

byline.original: By AL BAKER and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington, and Ashley Southall from New York.

lead_paragraph: James B. Comey, the bureau director, said that Tashfeen Malik and Syed Rizwan Farook used private online messages to communicate their commitment to Islamic extremists, not social media.

headline.main: San Bernardino Attackers Discussed Jihad in Private Messages, F.B.I. Says
headline.print_headline: California Attackers Discussed Jihad Privately, F.B.I. Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
